reflections.title: Charlotte's Web
reflections.author: E. B. White
reflections.thoughts: The story focuses on friendship between a little girl named Charlotte and a pig named Wilbur. I learned that true friendship is immeasurably invaluable, and that I must respect all and strive for humility.

reflections.title: Building Identity as a Third Culture Kid
reflections.author: Erik Vyhmeiste
reflections.thoughts: As a TCK, I felt heard and known. It is encouraging to know that there are others who also struggling to find home in a single community.

reflections.title: Meaning of Marriage
reflections.author: Timothy Keller
reflections.thoughts: Insight to the Christian values of marriage. Author refers to his personal experiences as well as wisdom from the bible.

reflections.title: Benefits of a Bilingual Brain
reflections.author: Mia Nacamulli
reflections.thoughts: Allowed me to reflect on how my bilingualism can be used not merely as a means of communication, but an added lens when perceiving the world

reflections.title: Enneagram and Coffee — Levels of Health for Type 3
reflections.author: Sarajane Case
reflections.thoughts: Levels of health for enneagram type 3 — helpful tool to gauge where I'm at

reflections.title: Inside the mind of a master procrastinator
reflections.author: Tim Urban
reflections.thoughts: The worst thing about being a procrastinator is, you know exactly why you're failing.

reflections.title: The Old Man and the Sea
reflections.author: Ernest Hemingway
